GENERAL: 
 
Tubing, fittings, and valves shall be factory sealed with end caps and individually bagged.  Tubing, fittings and 
valves shall be manufactured, tested, inspected, marked, cleaned, packaged, documented, and installed in 
compliance with the applicable requirements of the latest edition of the ASME Bioprocessing Equipment 
Standard (BPE) standard.  
 
For compressed gases, in accordance with CGA G-4.1, all tubing, fittings, gaskets and valves shall be cleaned, 
packaged and identified for use in oxygen services.  Refer to PSAT to determine where used in compressed gas 
systems.  
 
FINISH: 
 
Tubing, Fittings 
ID: 
Bright annealed (SF0). 
OD: 
Bright annealed or pickled outside diameter. 
 
TUBING: 
 
Material 
Stainless steel, Type 316L, annealed, sanitary tubing.      
 
1/2" - 1"  
Seamless or welded seam, ASTM A270/S2, 0.065" wall thickness. 
1-1/2" - 3" 
Welded seam, ASTM A270/S2, 0.065" wall thickness. 
4" 
Welded seam, ASTM A270/S2, 0.083" wall thickness. 
6" 
Welded seam, ASTM A270/S2, 0.109" wall thickness. 
 
Manufacturer 
Tubing shall be produced by an ASME certified ASME-BPE manufacturer 
 
FITTINGS: 
 
Material 
Stainless steel, Type 316L, annealed.  Wall thickness shall match tubing specifications. 
 
END CONNECTIONS: 
 
Butt weld 
All Sizes 
Extended tangent fittings suitable for automatic orbital welding.   
 
Clamp 
All Sizes  
Sanitary clamp end suitable for clamps as specified in this section. 
 
Manufacturer 
Fittings and valve end connections shall be butt weld unless otherwise indicated.  Fittings 
shall be produced by an ASME certified ASME-BPE manufacturer.

Automatic machine butt weld (orbital welded), unless otherwise specified or shown on the 
drawings to be Hygienic clamp joint fitting (HJC) or ASME Flange. 
 
CLAMPS:  
 
General 
1/2", 3/4"

Clamp 13MHHS-3/4-S, or approved equal.

Stainless steel, Type 304, polished, heavy duty, double-pin, Hygienic

permissible up to 4", Triclamp 13MHHS or approved equal. 
 
1" - 6"

Clamp 13MHP or approved equal.  High temperature systems (hot WFI, 
Clean Steam, CIP, etc.)

FLANGES 
 
All flanges shall ASME B16.5 Class 150 forged 316L stainless steel slip on style with raised faces.  Install 
flanges on tubing per ASME BPE recommendations.  Flanges shall only be used with Owner/Engineer 
approval. 
 
Gaskets shall be ASME B16.20 style of the same material as indicated for hygienic clamp connections. 
 
Flange bolting shall be ASTM A193 grade B8 stainless steel heavy hex head machine bolts, with ASTM A194 
grade G8 stainless steel heavy hex full nuts and 18-8 stainless steel flat washers.  Swagelok MS-PTS threads 
lubricant/sealant or equivalent on bolts. 
 
VALVES: 
 
General 
All valves of the same type shall be provided by the same manufacturer for this project.  
Contractor or Manufacturer shall allow for selection of any of the listed vendors at a later 
date. 
 
Butt weld ends shall meet the dimensions of ASME BPE Table DT-4.1-1 Tangent Lengths 
suitable for automatic orbital welding.  
 
Valves with elastomers exposed to passivation chemistry may be specified with elastomers 
for service during passivation of stainless steel systems in addition to the permanently 
installed elastomer. The valve must be tagged to indicate that passivation elastomers are 
installed, the passivation elastomers must be lot traceable, and the materials used for the 
elastomers installed during passivation must meet or exceed any exclusion of animal 
components in the elastomer formulation.

SECTION 230510 
HYDRONIC SYSTEM SPECIALTIES 
 
 
INDEX 
PAGE 
 
PART 1. - GENERAL 
 
1.1. 
RELATED DOCUMENTS 
 
Drawings and the general provisions of the contract, including general and supplementary conditions of Div. 01 
specification sections, apply to this section. 
 
1.2. 
SUBMITTALS 
 
Product data for each item specified here-in. 
 
1.3. 
QUALITY ASSURANCE 
 
ASME B 31.9 “Building Services Piping” for materials, products, and installation. 
 
Safety valves and pressure vessels shall bear the appropriate ASME label.  Fabricate and stamp air separators and 
expansion tanks to comply with ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code: Section VIII, Division 01. 
 
1.4. 
EXTRA MATERIALS 
 
For each type of balancing valve and automatic flow control valve, provide flowmeter, probe, hoses, flow charts 
and carrying case.  Turn over to Owner at system start-up/turnover. 
 
 
PART 2. - PRODUCTS 
 
2.1. 
ACCEPTABLE MANUFACTURERS 
 
Subject to compliance with requirements, provide hydronic piping system specialties from one of the following 
acceptable manufacturers listed for specialty item: 
 
2.2. 
FLEXIBLE CONNECTORS 
 
Length:  Flexible connector length shall be at least four (4) times pipe diameter. 
 
2" and Smaller: Corrugated hose and braided exterior sleeve; Stainless steel for steel piping; Bronze for Copper 
piping. 
 
3" and Larger: 304 stainless steel corrugated hose and braid and with carbon steel flanged end connections for 
steel piping; bronze flanges for copper piping.  Minimum rated working pressure of 150 psig at 200°F and working 
temperature range of 0°F to 250°F.  Capable of 1” static and ¾” dynamic offset from centerline minimum. 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Metraflex 
Flexonics 
Hyspan 
Amber Booth 
 
2.3. 
FLEXIBLE CONNECTORS – SPHERICAL TYPE 
 
Provide spherical flexible connectors as indicated on drawings and schedules.  Non-metallic, flexible connectors 
shall be of the molded spherical type with integral cable restraints.  The connector shall include neoprene and 
nylon body construction with internal steel wire end reinforcement, molded within the raised face ends. Joints 
shall be pressure rated for 225 psig at 170ºF with maximum operating temperature of 230 ºF at 70 psig.  Flanges 
shall be one-piece, free-floating, class 150 galvanized steel with permanently affixed control cables to prevent 
over-extension. Control cables shall be aircraft type, galvanized steel, and shall be an integral part of the joint 
requiring no field adjustment.  
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Metraflex (Cablesphere Basis of Design) 
Mason Industries, Inc. 
Garlock Sealing Technologies 
 
2.4. 
FLEXIBLE CONNECTORS FOR PLASTIC LINED PIPE 
 
Length:  Flexible connector length shall be at least four (4) times pipe diameter. 
 
2" and Smaller: Inner hose and braided exterior sleeve; Stainless steel for steel piping; Bronze for Copper piping. 
 
3" and Larger: Rated working pressure of 125 psig and temperature of 60°F to 160°F.  Three (3) convolute bellows 
of contour molded, extrusion grade virgin Teflon TFE T62, ASTM D-1457, Type 3, with monel reinforcing rings.  
Connectors shall be capable of a minimum of 1/4" misalignment.  Flanged end connections:  Steel for steel piping; 
Bronze for Copper piping. 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Resistoflex 
Flexonics 
 
2.5. 
FLEXIBLE UTILITY HOSES 
 
Flexible hoses shall be suitable for use with propylene glycol water mixtures.  Tubing shall be FDA white EPDM 
rubber reinforced with two (2) polyester spirals and a dual helix wire, and a colored EPDM cover (green for 
 
shall be of smooth bore construction and shall be manufactured for sanitary applications.  Tubing shall be capable 
of operating at full vacuum to 150 psig working pressure and have a temperature range of –40°F to 350°F.  Tubing 
fittings shall be factory installed integral with the hose, 316L stainless steel NPT unless indicated otherwise in 
hose schedule.  Length of hose shall be as required for application but shall not be less than 12 inches (exclusive 
of end fittings) unless indicated otherwise. 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Flexible Components Series TLCT 
 
2.6. 
FLEXIBLE HOSE QUICK CONNECTS 
 
Quick Connects:  Double-end automatic shut-off type, with inadvertent uncoupling safety mechanism.  Rated 
working pressure of 125 psig, 75 psig when coupled, and temperature of 35°F. to 150°F.  316 stainless steel body 
and components, seals, packings, and back-up rings of appropriate material for the fluid conveyed, internally 
lubricated, and line size female NPT end connections. 
 
Acceptable Manufacturer(s) 
 
Swagelok “QTM” Series (up to 1”) 
Eaton “MLFF” Series (up to 2”) 
Parker “59 Series” (up to 1 ½”) 
 
2.7. 
SPECIAL DUTY VALVES 
 
2.7.1. 
Calibrated Balancing Valves (Circuit Setters)  
 
For 2-1/2” and smaller pipe sizes:  Rated working pressure of 125 psig, and temperature of 240°F.  Bronze body 
plug or ball valve, with calibrated orifice, differential pressure meter connections (1/4” connection size minimum) 
with integral check valves and seals, integral pointer, and degree of valve opening calibrated scale.  End 
connections: 2" and smaller: threaded or sweat type connections; 2-1/2", flanged.   
 
For 3” and larger pipe sizes:  Rated working pressure of 125 psig (Min.), and temperature of 240°F.  Cast iron or 
ductile iron body, plug or ball valve (brass construction with bronze seat with EPDM seal-insert), with calibrated 
orifice, differential pressure meter connections (1/4” connection size minimum) with integral check valves and 
seals, integral pointer, and degree of valve opening calibrated scale.  Valves shall have memory stops integral to 
valve, to permit valve to be closed for service and then re-opened to setpoint without disturbing balanced valve 
setting / position.  End connections: 3" and larger, flanged (ASME/ANSI B16.42, Class 150).   
 
Valves shall be provided with molded insulation to permit access for balancing.  Pre-molded insulation shells for 
balancing valves (and/or other valve types) shall be provided either by the valve vendor or through a third-party 
vendor such as: Kemper GmbH insulating shells or approved equal for the system application and temperature. 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Bell & Gossett ITT; Fluid Handling Division 
Nexus Valve 
Nibco 
Flow Design, Inc. 
 
2.7.2. 
Y-Pattern Globe Balancing Valves  
 
Y-pattern globe style balancing valve with integral differential pressure ports.  Rated working pressure of 200 
psig, and temperatures to 250°F.  Valves up to 2” shall be made of either: die cast nonporous Ametal copper alloy 
 
be ductile iron body with Ametal copper alloy internal components.  Valves shall provide precise flow 
measurement, precision flow balancing, and positive flow shut-off with no-drip seat.  Valves shall be constructed 
so that maximum setting is reached with full turns and handwheel includes memory feature and tamper-proof 
balancing setting.  End connections; 2" and smaller, threaded; 2-1/2" and larger, flanged.   
 
Valves shall be provided with molded insulation to permit access for balancing.  
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
TA (Tour & Andersson) by IMI Hydronic Engineering Inc., STAD or STAF-SG 
Armstrong Fluid Technology 
Nexus Valve 
 
2.7.3. 
Coil Piping and Valve Assembly Kits (for small coils)  
 
Provide coil piping and valve assembly (or “hook-up”) kits where indicated for ½” through 2” coils.  Coil kit 
component bodies shall be forged or cast brass ASTM B283 rated for a minimum of 600 psig WOG at 325°F.   
Provide with extended pressure and test plugs, manual air vents and extended handles to be accessible and 
operable without removal of insulation on system.  Component connection ends shall be NPT, SWT, PRESS or 
PUSH type to match the piping specification for the system and as required to connect to coil.  Provide 5-year 
product warranty.  
 
Each coil piping and valve assembly (or “hook-up”) kit shall include (in addition to that listed above): 
• 
Supply line combination ball valve and Y-strainer, with union ends, PT test plug and blowdown/drain 
valve. 
o 
Union ends with FKM O-ring seal 
o 
Blowout proof stem with FKM O-rings 
o 
Stainless steel ball and valve stem with Teflon seats 
o 
304 stainless steel strainer filter screen (20 mesh standard or 40 mesh optional) 
o 
Multiple ¼” tapped test ports.  
o 
Drain valve with threaded end cap on end of strainer. 
• 
Return line combination union, manual air vent and PT test plug upstream of control valve. 
o 
Union ends with Viton O-ring seal 
o 
Multiple ¼” tapped test port and air vent. 
• 
Return line combination flow control balance valve, PT test plugs, ball valve and union end. 
o 
Flow control balance valve with memory stop with graduated Cv scale. 
o 
Union ends with FKM O-ring seal 
o 
Blowout proof stem with FKM O-rings 
o 
Stainless steel ball and valve stem with Teflon seats 
o 
Multiple ¼” tapped test ports.  
• 
Supply and return stainless steel braided hoses. 
o 
Rated for 300 psig at 248°F. 
o 
Stainless steel braiding over a Kevlar reinforced EPDM rubber tube 
o 
Meet or exceed ASTM E84 fire smoke rating. 
o 
Brass NPSM swivel with seal or brass MNPT end fittings 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Nexus Valve, Inc.  Coil Pak O2Y 
Bell & Gossett Coil Pak MC2Y 
Nibco Flo Boss Coil Kit  
 
 
 
 
2.7.4. 
Automatic Flow Control Valves  
 
Brass body valve with 304 stainless steel removable flow cartridge and working pressure rating of 150 psig and 
temperatures to 250F, with brass plug, EPDM cartridge seal and FKM o-ring cap seal.  Factory set to 
automatically control design flow rates ± 5%, while compensating for system operating pressure differential.  
Furnished with valve kit consisting of 1/4" x 2" size nipples, quick disconnect inlet/outlet connections, and fittings 
for flow measuring instrument connection.  Provide metal identification tag with chain, factory marked with zone 
identification, valve model number, and rated flow.  End connections: 2" and smaller, threaded; 2-1/2" and larger, 
flanged. 
 
Acceptable Manufacturer(s) 
 
Nexus Valve 
Griswold Controls 
Flow Design, Inc. 
 
2.7.5. 
Differential Pressure Control Valves  
 
Pilot-operated flow-limiting double regulating control valve with adjustable differential pressure setting, integral 
measuring points, and full flow shut-off.  Furnish with two-way measuring points, capillary pipe connection shut-
offs on valve and pilot and setting tool for each valve. 
 
2-1/2” and smaller: Valve and pilot constructed of bronze with stainless spring, stainless steel internals, EPDM 
o-rings, EPDM membrane (or nylon-reinforced BUNA-N), (with polyamide handwheel, where applicable) and 
copper control tubing with brass valves (or alternate: stainless steel control tubing and valves). 
 
3” and larger: Valve and pilot constructed of epoxy painted ductile iron with stainless spring with stainless steel 
internals, EPDM o-rings, EPDM membrane (or nylon-reinforced BUNA-N), (with polyamide handwheel, where 
applicable) and copper control tubing with brass valves (or alternate: stainless steel control tubing and valves).   
 
Acceptable Manufacturer(s) 
 
Tour & Anderson 
Danfoss 
Crane Fluid Systems 
Watts 
Singer Valve 
 
2.7.6. 
Pump Discharge Valves 
 
Rated working pressure of 175 psig, and temperature of 300°F.  Iron body with bolt-on bonnet, externally guided 
bronze disc and soft resilient seat, manufacturer’s standard stem material, stainless steel spring, and “Teflon” 
packing or buna o-ring.  Features shall include non-slam check valve with spring-loaded weighted disc, calibrated 
flow regulation adjustment and shutoff, and designed to permit repacking under full line pressure.  Flanged end 
connections and straight or angle pattern as indicated. 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Bell & Gossett ITT; Fluid Handling Division 
Armstrong Pumps, Inc. 
Mueller Steam Specialty 
 
2.7.7. 
Combined Pressure/Temperature Safety Valves 
 
Provide combined pressure/temperature safety valves as indicated.  Valves shall have a permanently mounted tag, 
 
capacity.  Valves shall be tested for proper operation, prior to installation, and provided with a certification form, 
indicating conformance to test and to applicable ASME standard. 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Watts Regulator Company 
Spirax Sarco 
Bell & Gossett ITT; Fluid Handling Division 
 
2.7.8. 
Pressure Safety Valves 
 
Provide pressure safety valves as indicated.  Valves shall have a permanently mounted tag, indicating 
manufacturer, model number, serial number, pressure settings, and rated discharge capacity.  Valves shall be 
tested for proper operation, prior to installation, and provided with a certification form, indicating conformance 
to test and to applicable ASME standard. 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Watts Regulator Company 
Spirax Sarco 
Bell & Gossett ITT; Fluid Handling Division 
 
2.7.9. 
Pressure Reducing Valves 
 
Size and operating pressure as indicated on drawings.  Diaphragm operated, bronze body valve, stainless steel 
valve seat, stainless steel/bronze trim, and removable spring cage assembly for disc replacement, or inspection of 
internals without removing body from piping.  Factory-set at operating pressure and capable of field adjustment.   
 
End Connections:  2” and smaller, threaded; 2-1/2” and larger, flanged. 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Jordan Valve 
Watts Regulator Company 
Spence Regulators 
 
2.7.10. Back-Pressure Regulating Valves 
 
Provide pilot operated back-pressure regulator of size and operating pressure as indicated on drawings.  Sliding 
gate regulator, straight through flow design, ANSI Class IV tight shutoff with pilot rated for 285 psig at 100°F.  
Valve shall be carbon steel (A216 WCB) body, 303SS trim, Jorcote/Jordanic on SST seats and Jorlon diaphragam 
or equivalent seats and diaphragm.  Factory-set at operating pressure and capable of field adjustment.   
 
End Connections:  2” and smaller, threaded; 2-1/2” and larger, flanged. 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Jordan Valve 
Watts Regulator Company 
Spence Regulators 
 
2.7.11. Drain (Discharge) Tempering Valves 
 
For use in tempering (reducing) the discharge temperature of hot fluid waste being discharged to a waste open 
 
Valve construction (for drain-line sizes 1” to 1-1/4” and ½” to 1” water line size):  Brass body, with thermal 
actuator, operating spring, piston and ram-type plug: 304 or 316 series stainless steel, a PTFE seat seal, with FPT 
inlet connection.  Valve shall be self-regulating (via the thermal actuator) in order to adjust the incoming cold 
city water capacity to modulate to control the outlet temperature of the discharge to the drain system.  Valve shall 
be rated for: 125 psig maximum water inlet pressure and a maximum system temperature of 250 degrees F. 
 
Also provide an integral inlet backflow preventor and water hammer arrestor device (between the inlet BFP and 
the tempering valve) sized per the tempering valve nominal inlet line size. 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
ThermOmegaTech, Inc. 
 
2.8. 
HYDRONIC SPECIALTIES 
 
2.8.1. 
Cast Bronze Y-Strainers (1/2” – 2”) 
 
Class 125, cast bronze body (ASTM B62), type 304 stainless steel screen (20 mesh), self-cleaning design with 
blowdown tapping piped to ball valve and threaded outlet cap.  End connections: threaded. ASME/ANSI B16.18. 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Mueller 
Keckley 
Nibco 
 
2.8.2. 
Cast Iron Y-Strainers (2-1/2” and larger)

piping and 0.125” perforations for piping larger than 4”), self-cleaning design and furnished with blowdown 
tapping piped to ball valve and threaded outlet cap.  End connections:  Flanged.  ANSI B16.1. 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Keckley

Nibco 
 
2.8.3.

self-cleaning design with blowdown tapping piped to ball valve and threaded outlet cap.  End connections: 
threaded or socketweld to match pipe specification.

2.8.4.

150 lb., 316 stainless steel body (ASTM A351, Grade CF8M), type 304 stainless steel screen (0.062” perforations 
for 2-1/2”-4” piping and 0.125” perforations for piping larger than 4”), self-cleaning design and furnished with 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Keckley 
Mueller 
Titan 
 
2.8.5. 
Basket Strainers 
 
Simplex, Class 150, cast carbon steel (ASTM A216) body and bolted or swing-clamp cover, type 304 stainless 
steel screen with manufacturer’s standard perforation size.  For strainers installed in 4” and larger piping, include 
drain tapping in body piped to ball valve and threaded outlet cap.  End connections:  2" and smaller, threaded; 2-
1/2" and larger, flanged. Seals shall be EPDM.  Include accessory magnetic basket insert.   
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Mueller 
Armstrong International 
Eaton Filtration 
Keckley 
 
2.8.6. 
Manual Air Vent 
 
Rated working pressure of 150 psig, and temperature of 225°F.  Bronze or brass body, nonferrous internal parts, 
discharge connection copper tube pig-tail, and manually operated with screwdriver or thumbscrew.  1/2" ball 
valves may be used in lieu of manual air vents.   
 
2.8.7. 
Automatic Air Vent 
 
Non-modulating, float type for automatic venting of air.  Rated working pressure of 150 psig, and temperature of 
240°F.  Cast iron, bronze or brass body, nonferrous internal parts, discharge connection copper tube pig-tail, and 
1/2" inlet connection. 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Armstrong 
Amtrol 
Bell & Gossett ITT; Fluid Handling Division 
 
2.8.8. 
Diaphragm and Bladder-Type Expansion Tanks 
 
Capacity, and size as indicated on Drawings.  Rated working pressure of 125 psig, and temperature of 240°F.  
Constructed, tested, and labeled in accordance with ASME Pressure Vessel Code, Section VIII, Division 1.  
Welded carbon steel tank, heavy duty butyl diaphragm or bladder, with gauge glass, pressure gauge tap, air charge 
fitting, and drain fitting.  Provide steel legs for vertical tanks, or steel saddle for horizontal tanks. 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
Amtrol 
Armstrong 
Bell & Gossett ITT; Fluid Handling Division 
 
2.8.9. 
Air/Dirt Separator  
 
Full flow coalescing type combination air eliminator and dirt separator.  Rated working pressure of 150 psig, and 
temperature of 270°F.  Entering velocity shall not exceed 10 fps.  Constructed, tested, stamped, and registered in 
 
construction with bolted removable bonnet and flanged inlet and outlet connections.  Unit design shall suppress 
turbulence and provide air elimination efficiency of 100% free air, 100% entrained air, and 99.6% dissolved air 
at the installed location.  Dirt separation efficiency shall be a minimum of 80% of all particles 30 micron and 
larger after 100 passes.  Include automatic air vent, blowdown ball valve and threaded cap. 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Spirotherm 
Amtrol 
Armstrong 
Bell & Gossett ITT; Fluid Handling Division 
 
2.8.10. Pump Suction Diffusers 
 
Rated working pressure of 175 psig, and temperature of 250°F.  Cast-iron body, inlet vanes, bottom blowdown 
tap, side gauge tap, and adjustable foot support.  Blowdown tap shall be provided with ball valve and threaded 
nipple.  End connections: 2" and smaller, threaded; 2-1/2" and larger, flanged.  Provide with the following optional 
features:   
 
Cylinder strainer, stainless steel, 3/16" perforations, total free area ≥ 5 times cross-sectional pump suction area 
and designed to withstand pump shutoff head pressure differential.  Provide with a fine mesh start-up strainer 
(that shall be removed after system start-up). 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers 
 
Bell & Gossett ITT; Fluid Handling Division 
Mueller 
Armstrong 
Amtrol 
Taco Pumps 
 
 
PART 3. - EXECUTION 
 
Install hydronic system specialties as shown on the drawings, and in accordance with manufacturer's instructions 
and recommendations.    Install in a location readily accessible for maintenance and inspection. 
 
3.1. 
VALVE APPLICATIONS 
 
Install automatic flow control valves on the outlet of each heating or cooling element and elsewhere as shown. 
 
Install safety relief valves where shown and as required by ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code.  Pipe 
discharge to floor, unless shown otherwise.  Comply with ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code Section VIII, 
Division 1 for installation requirements. 
 
3.2. 
HYDRONIC SPECIALTIES INSTALLATION 
 
Install manual air vents at high points in the system, at heat transfer coils, and elsewhere as indicated for system 
air venting. 
Install y-pattern and basket strainers in supply branch piping ahead of control valves, heating / cooling coils, heat 
exchangers, and elsewhere as required to protect control and heat transfer equipment.  Provide startup screens in 
all strainers and replace with final screens after the system has been flushed. 
 
Install diaphragm-type expansion tanks as indicated.  Vent and purge air from hydronic system, charge tank with 
 
Install combination air/dirt separators in hydronic piping systems indicated.  Provide three-valve bypass around 
each air/dirt separator.  Where separators are installed more than 6’-0” above the floor, extend blowdown piping 
to indirect drain. 
 
 
END OF SECTION 
SECTION 230520 
STEAM SYSTEM SPECIALTIES 
 
 
INDEX

PART 1. - GENERAL 
 
1.1. 
RELATED DOCUMENTS 
 
Drawings and general provisions of the contract, including general and supplementary conditions and Division 
01 specification sections, apply to this section. 
 
1.2. 
QUALITY ASSURANCE 
 
ASME B 31.9 “Building Services Piping”:  For materials, products, and installation. 
 
ASME “Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code”:  Section IX, “Welding and Brazing Qualification” for qualifications 
for welding processes and operators. 
 
Certify that each welder has passed AWS qualification tests for welding processes involved and that certification 
is current. 
 
1.3. 
SUBMITTALS 
 
Product Data:  Submit product data for each item included.  Submit calculations and sizing data for all pressure 
reducing valves and safety relief valves. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
PART 2. - PRODUCTS  
 
2.1. 
ACCEPTABLE MANUFACTURERS

system specialties from one of the following:

Pressure Reducing Valves 
Spirax Sarco

Watson McDaniel 
 
2.2. 
STEAM TRAPS 
 
Float and Thermostatic Traps: Cast-iron body and bolted cap conforming to one of the following:  ASTM A126 
Class B, A278 Class 30, or A48 Class 30.  Renewable, stainless steel float mechanism, with renewable stainless 
steel valve and seat; balanced pressure thermostatic air vent made of renewable stainless steel or bronze element 
with renewable stainless steel valve and seat. 
 
Inverted Bucket Traps: Cast-iron body and cap rated for 250 psi working pressure and conforming to one of the 
following: ASTM A126 Class B, A278 Class 30, or A48 Class 30. Stainless steel head and seat; stainless steel 
valve retainer, lever, guide pin assembly, and stainless steel bucket. 
 
2.3. 
AIR VENTS 
 
Thermostatic Air Vents: Manufacturer’s standard body material, with balanced pressure beryllium copper, 
phosphor bronze, stainless steel, or monel thermostatic bellows, and stainless steel heads and seats.  300 psig 
rating. 
 
Float-Thermostatic Air Vents: Cast-iron or brass body; balance pressure thermostatic bellows; replaceable 
stainless steel seat, float, and head. 35 psig rating. 
 
2.4. 
VACUUM BREAKERS 
 
Vacuum Breakers: Brass or stainless steel body, brass or stainless steel ball or stem type valve, EPR o-ring seal, 
and minimum ½” threaded system connection.  300 psig rating. 
 
 
 
 
2.5. 
STRAINERS 
 
Y-Pattern Strainers: Minimum 250 psig steam working pressure. 
Cast carbon steel body conforming to ASTM A216, Grade WCB, type 304 stainless steel screen (maximum 30 
mesh for 2” and smaller); tapped blow-off for gate valve, and threaded nipple.  End connections: 2” and smaller 
socket weld, 2-1/2" and larger flanged. 
 
Stainless Steel Y-Strainers (1/2” – 2”):  600 lb rated, 316 Stainless Steel body (ASTM A351, Grade CF8M), type 
304 stainless steel screen (20 mesh), self-cleaning design with blowdown tapping piped to ball valve and threaded 
outlet cap.  End connections: threaded or socketweld to match pipe specification.  
 
Stainless Steel Y-Strainers (2-1/2” and larger): 150 lb, 316 stainless steel body (ASTM A351, Grade CF8M), type 
304 stainless steel screen (0.062” perforations for 2-1/2”-4” piping and 0.125” perforations for piping larger than 
4”), self-cleaning design and furnished with blowdown tapping piped to ball valve and threaded outlet cap.  End 
connections:  Flanged.  ANSI B16.1. 
 
2.6. 
DRIP PAN ELBOWS 
 
General:  Provide drip pan elbows for use with safety/relief valves.  Elbows shall conform to the Power Piping 
Code and shall be ASTM A126 Class B cast iron, and be of the same size as the valve or larger.  It shall have a 
pan to collect condensate in the steam riser pipe and a drain to pipe away the condensate.  Provide inlet with 
threaded or flanged ends for application.  Elbow shall be rated for 250 psig (17 barg) and operating temperature 
of 450°F (232°C).  Pipe as shown on drawings. 
 
2.7. 
PRESSURE REDUCING VALVES 
 
Pilot-actuated, diaphragm type, adjustable pressure range, and positive shut-off; steel body, hardened stainless 
steel trim, and replaceable valve head and seat.  Main head stem guide fitted with flushing and pressure arresting 
device, noise attenuator, and covered standard pilot regulator.  There shall be no springs in the steam path, or 
stuffing boxes. Connections shall be flanged for 2-1/2" and larger, and threaded for 2" and under. 
 
 
PART 3. - EXECUTION 
 
3.1. 
SPECIALTIES INSTALLATION 
 
Install steam system specialties as shown on the drawings, and in accordance with manufacturer's instructions 
and recommendations.    Install in a location readily accessible for maintenance and inspection. 
 
3.2. 
STEAM TRAP INSTALLATIONS 
 
Install steam traps as close as possible, but no greater than four (4) feet to connected equipment. 
 
Refer to drawings and 230500 PIPING MATERIALS AND METHODS for steam trap location requirements.  
 
3.3. 
PRESSURE SAFETY VALVE INSTALLATIONS 
 
Refer to specification 230275 PRESSURE SAFETY RELIEF DEVICES. 
 
 
END OF SECTION 
SECTION 230526 
CONDENSATE HANDLING EQUIPMENT 
 
 
INDEX 
PAGE 
 
PART 1. - GENERAL 
 
1.1. 
QUALITY ASSURANCE 
 
NEC Compliance:  Install equipment in accordance with applicable electrical requirements of NFPA 70, 
“National Electrical Code.” 
 
Install equipment in accordance with requirements of local and state boiler codes, and applicable provisions of 
NFPA and ASME Boiler Code Standards. 
 
Electrical Components, Devices, and Accessories:  Listed and labeled as defined in NFPA 70, Article 100, by a 
testing agency acceptable to authorities having jurisdiction, and marked for intended use. 
 
ASME Compliance:  ASME B31.9, “Building Services Piping,” for systems equal to or less than 15 psig (104 
kPa).  Safety valves and pressure vessels shall bear the appropriate ASME label. 
 
1.2. 
DELIVERY, STORAGE, AND HANDLING 
 
Preparation for Shipping:  Clean flanges and exposed-metal surfaces and treat with anticorrosion compound 
after assembly and testing.  Protect flanges, pipe openings, and nozzles with wooden flange covers or with 
screwed-in plugs. 
 
Store units in dry location. 
Retain protective flange covers and machined-surface protective coatings during storage. 
 
Protect bearings and couplings against damage from sand, grit, and other foreign matter. 
 
Comply with manufacturer’s written rigging instructions. 
 
1.3. 
COORDINATION 
 
Coordinate size and location of concrete bases.  Cast anchor-bolt inserts into bases.  Concrete, reinforcement, 
and formwork requirements are specified in Division 03. 
 
 
 
PART 2. - PRODUCTS 
 
2.1. 
ACCEPTABLE MANUFACTURERS 
 
Manufacturers:  Subject to compliance with requirements, provide condensate-handling equipment of one of the 
following: 
 
Condensate Pump and Receiver Sets 
 
Spirax Sarco 
Skidmore 
Armstrong 
 
2.2. CONDENSATE PUMP AND RECEIVER SETS 
 
General:  Provide condensate pump and receiver set(s) as indicated in the data sheets. 
 
 
PART 3. - EXECUTION  
 
3.1. 
INSTALLATION OF CONDENSATE HANDLING EQUIPMENT 
 
General: 
Install condensate handling equipment where shown, in accordance with manufacturer's published 
installation instructions, complying with recognized industry practices, local and state codes, to ensure that 
equipment complies with requirements and serves intended purpose. 
 
Install condensate handling equipment plumb and level, in locations indicated.  Anchor equipment firmly using 
inserts or anchor bolts, unless specifically indicated otherwise. 
 
Access:  Provide access space around units for service as indicated, but in no case less than clearances 
recommended by manufacturer.  
 
Support:  Install condensate handling equipment plumb and level, on 4" thick reinforced concrete pad, 4" larger 
on each side than unit base, where indicated. 
 
Electrical Wiring:  Install electrical devices furnished by manufacturer but not factory-mounted.  Verify that 
electrical wiring installation is in accordance with submittal data. 
 
Accessories:  Install all accessories provided by manufacturer, but not factory installed, in accordance with 
manufacturer’s instructions. 
 
Piping Connections: Provide piping, valves, etc. as shown on drawings for all equipment connections. Provide 
eccentric reducers as required at equipment connections to mate piping to equipment.  Provide overflow and 
drain piping to nearest floor drain, unless specifically shown otherwise.  Provide full size vent piping as 
indicated on drawings. 
 
Drain Connections:  Provide funnels or stainless steel shields to prevent splashing of effluent beyond perimeter 
of drains. 
 
3.2. 
START-UP 
 
Start-Up:  After installation is complete, startup condensate handling equipment in accordance with 
manufacturer's start-up instructions.  Test and adjust controls and safeties and demonstrate compliance with 
requirements.  Replace damaged or malfunctioning controls and equipment. 
 
3.3. 
TRAINING 
 
Train the Owner's personnel on start-up and shutdown procedures, troubleshooting procedures, and servicing 
and preventative maintenance schedules and procedures.  Review the data in the Operating and Maintenance 
Manuals, with the Owner's authorized personnel.  Schedule training with Owner and provide at least seven (7) 
days’ notice to Owner prior to training date. 
 
Provide a manufacturer's technical representative for one (1) eight-hour day to train the Owner's personnel.  
 
3.4. 
ADJUSTING AND CLEANING 
 
Adjustment:  Set controls to operate at proper levels, set valves on pump discharges for specified flow.  Check 
for proper rotation of three-phase motors. 
 
 
END OF SECTION

SECTION 230540 
PUMPS 
 
 
INDEX 
PAGE 
 
PART 1. -  GENERAL 
 
1.1. 
SUMMARY 
 
The specification indicates the requirements for the design, manufacture, testing, and installation of pumps.  
Attached to and part of this specification are data sheets for each pump. 
 
1.2. 
QUALITY ASSURANCE 
 
The design, manufacture, testing and installation of pumps shall comply with the applicable requirements of the 
most recent edition of the following codes and standards: 
 
Hydraulic Institute Standards 
ASME BPE (hygienic pumps only) 
ANSI 
ASTM 
AGMA (gearboxes) 
UL (motors and electrical controls and components) 
NEMA 
IEEE 
IEC 
 
1.3. 
SUBMITTALS 
 
Reference specification section 230010 – Basic Mechanical requirements for submittal requirements in addition 
to those indicated in this section. 
 
1.3.1. 
Completed Data Sheets 
 
The Vendor/Manufacturer shall complete all fields indicated as VS* (Vendor Specified) on each data sheet, as 
well as correct/modify any other fields and values as required, and submit them with the initial bid, and as part of 
the final submittal documentation. 
 
1.3.2. 
Hygienic Pumps 
 
Hygienic pumps are those that are indicated as required to comply with ASME BPE on the data sheets.  Hygienic 
pumps will be used for critical biopharmaceutical systems (product contact, USP compendial water, CIP, etc.), 
and shall comply with all applicable requirements of ASME BPE, including the following GMP documentation 
requirements: 
 
• 
Surface Finish Certifications 
• 
Certificates of Compliance 
• 
Manufacturer's Data and Test Reports 
• 
Non-Destructive Examination (NDE) Reports 
 
The Vendor/Manufacturer shall provide documentation verifying the wetted materials of construction meet the 
requirements indicated in the specifications. 
 
 
PART 2. -  PRODUCTS 
 
2.1. 
ACCEPTABLE MANUFACTURERS 
 
Products: Subject to compliance with requirements, provide products of one of the following: 
 
Base-Mounted Pumps 
Bell & Gossett, ITT 
Aurora Pumps 
Goulds Pumps 
Peerless Pump 
Weinman Pumps 
Armstrong Pumps, Inc. 
 
 
Sanitary Pumps 
Fristam 
Waukesha Cherry-Burrell of SPX flow Technology 
G&H Division of Alfa Laval Flow Inc 
 
Diaphragm Pumps 
Wilden 
Versamatic 
Yamada 
 
Rotary Lobe Non-Sanitary Pumps 
LobePro Rotary Pumps 
Börger 
NETZSCH Pumps 
Wrightflow Technologies 
 
Rotary Lobe Sanitary Pumps 
Fristam 
Johnson Pumps division of SPX flow Technology 
Grundfos 
Alfa Laval Division of Alfa Laval Flow Inc. 
 
Magnetic Drive Pumps 
Goulds 
Magnetex 
Sundyne  
 
 
2.2. 
PUMPS 
 
Provide pumps as indicated on the attached data sheets and as indicated in the equipment schedules on plans. 
 
Pumps shall be factory-assembled and tested.  Fabricate casings to allow removal and replacement of impellers 
without the necessity of disturbing the connected piping apart from disconnecting from the pump.  Select each 
pump for operation at the center of its performance curve, near “Best Operating Efficiency Point”, unless indicated 
otherwise.  Model and impeller selection shall allow impeller replacement with both larger and smaller within 
same casing. 
 
Pump impellers shall be statically and dynamically balanced. 
 
Lobes on lobe pumps shall be provided with the clearances necessary to operate at the highest indicated 
temperatures, including SIP conditions, without interference with the pump casing. 
 
2.3. 
MOTORS 
 
Provide pump motors as indicated on the attached data sheets. 
 
Select motors that are non-overloading within the full range of the pump performance curve, unless indicated 
otherwise. 
 
Pumps/motors that are indicated as VFD compatible, or that will be powered by a VFD, shall be provided with 
an AEGIS SGR shaft grounding ring, as manufactured by Electrostatic Technologies, integrally mounted to the 
output shaft of the motor.  This requirement is in addition to providing motors that are otherwise compatible with 
and designed to operate with a VFD.  
 
Motors shall be designed for operation with AC variable frequency controllers (VFD) for speed control 
applications when specified in the driven equipment specification.  At a minimum, adjustable frequency driven 
motors shall meet NEMA MG-1 Section IV, and Part 31 standards.  In addition, these motors shall have a 
minimum CIV (Corona Inception Voltage) rating of 1,488 volts at rated operating temperature. 
 
2.4. 
INSTRUMENTATION AND CONTROLS 
 
When indicated as required on the pump data sheet, provide a self-contained control system meeting the 
requirements indicated. 
 
The Manufacturer shall warrant that all wiring and electrical components complies with the NEC, applicable UL 
requirements, and all applicable local electrical codes.  All wiring and components shall be rated appropriately, 
UL listed, and suitable for the environment in which the equipment is installed. 
 
For electrically driven pumps: In addition to the control requirements indicated on the data sheet, adequate 
controls shall be provided to allow for the full, proper, safe and intended operation of the equipment.  Interlocks 
shall be provided to prevent the unit from being operated outside its design envelope and set points, as well as for 
safety. 
 
All controls shall be installed in an electrical enclosure meeting indicated requirements.  Unless indicated 
otherwise, each enclosure shall be configured with the following components as a minimum: 
 
• 
Power or air switch 
• 
Power on or air on light 
• 
HAND/OFF/AUTO switch for electrically driven pumps 
• 
Alarm light 
• 
Reset button 
• 
Run light 
 
If local speed control is indicated as required, the VFD shall be mounted in the electrical enclosure, and the 
appropriate speed indicator and controls shall be mounted on the door of the enclosure to allow local operator 
 
The electrical enclosure shall be provided with a lockable disconnect switch on the door that will de-energize the 
system upon opening the door, unless indicated otherwise. 
 
 
PART 3. -  EXECUTION 
 
3.1. 
ASSEMBLY, STORAGE AND SHIPPING 
 
Assemble pumps in a clean area, and to the greatest extent possible, prevent the contamination of the interior of 
the pump with dirt and debris.  Clean finished pump assembly appropriately. 
 
Pump and motor assemblies that are indicated to be provided on a manufacturer/vendor supplied base shall be 
pre-assembled as such, including proper pump alignment, rotational checks, lubrication, painting and cleaning. 
 
Keep all openings on pumps capped and sealed whenever possible during assembly and installation operations, 
while in storage, and after installation but prior to connection to piping systems. 
 
After assembly and testing, clean piping connections and exposed machined metal surfaces and treat with an anti-
corrosion compound.  Protect flanges, pipe openings and nozzles.  Plug gauge, drain and vent taps. 
 
3.2. 
INSTALLATION 
 
3.2.1. 
Examination 
 
Examine areas, equipment foundations and conditions, with installer present, for compliance with requirements 
for installation tolerances and other conditions affecting performance of pumps. 
 
Examine rough-in for piping systems to verify actual locations of piping connections prior to installation. 
 
Do not proceed until unsatisfactory conditions have been corrected. 
 
3.2.2. 
Installation 
 
Install pumps as indicated on the drawings and as specified herein, and comply with the manufacturer's written 
installation and alignment instructions. 
 
Install pumps in locations and arrange to provide access for periodic maintenance, including removal of motors, 
impellers, couplings and accessories. 
 
Support pumps and piping separately so that the weight of the piping system does not rest on the pump. 
 
Suspend inline pumps using hanger rod and vibration isolation hangers of sufficient size to support the weight of 
the pump independent from the piping system, or from the floor using a pipe and pedestal mount, per the 
manufacturer's recommendations. 
 
Set base-mounted pumps on concrete foundations, unless otherwise indicated.  For pumps that are not close 
coupled or pre-assembled on a baseplate, disconnect coupling halves before setting.  Do not reconnect couplings 
until the alignment operations have been completed. 
 
Support pump bases on rectangular metal blocks and shims, or on metal wedges having a small taper, at points 
near the foundation bolts to provide a gap of 3/4 to 1-1/2" between the pump base and the foundation for grouting. 
 
Adjust the metal supports or wedges until the shafts of the pump and driver are level.  Check the coupling faces 
and suction and discharge flanges of the pump to verify that they are level and plumb.  After proper alignment 
 
3.2.3. 
Alignment 
 
Align pump and motor shafts (on pumps that are not close coupled or pre-assemble assemblies only), and piping 
connections after setting on foundations and piping connections have been made, but before grout has been set, 
and foundation bolts have been tightened. 
 
After alignment is correct, tighten the foundation bolts evenly, but not too firmly.  Fill the base plate completely 
with no shrink nonmetallic grout, with metal blocks and shims or wedges in place.  After grout has cured, fully 
tighten foundation bolts. 
 
Alignment tolerances shall meet manufacturer's recommendations. 
 
3.3. 
CONNECTIONS 
 
Install valves, piping and other accessories as indicated on the drawings and data sheets.  Provide swing elbows 
and sufficient fittings to allow pumps casings to be easily removed and installed for maintenance without the need 
to disturb adjoining piping. 
 
3.4. 
FIELD QUALITY CONTROL 
 
Check line connections for tightness to avoid drawing air into the pump or leakage on discharge. 
 
3.5. 
START-UP 
 
Perform preventative maintenance operations and checks in accordance with the recommendations of the pump 
manufacturer before start-up.  Lubricate lubricated type bearings.  Check motor for proper rotation.  Rotation 
shall match direction of rotation marked on pump casing. Clean strainers.  Check that pumps are free to rotate by 
hand.  For pumps handling hot liquids, pump shall be free to rotate with the pump hot and cold.  If the pump is 
bound or even drags slightly, do not operate the pump until the cause of the trouble is determined  and corrected. 
 
Start-up pumps in accordance with manufacturer's start-up procedures and recommendations. 
 
 
END OF SECTION

SECTION 230755 
HEAT EXCHANGERS 
 
 
INDEX 
PAGE 
 
PART 1. - GENERAL 
 
1.1. 
SUMMARY 
 
The specification indicates the requirements for the design, manufacture, testing, and installation of heat 
exchangers.  Attached to and part of this specification are data sheets for each heat exchanger. 
 
1.2. 
RELATED DOCUMENTS 
 
In addition to the drawings and general conditions specifications for the project, applicable sections of the 
following documents apply to and comprise part of this specification section: 
 
230010 – Basic Mechanical Requirements 
230050 – Basic Mechanical Materials and Methods 
 
1.3. 
QUALITY ASSURANCE 
 
The design, manufacture, testing and installation of heat exchangers shall comply with the applicable 
requirements of the most recent edition of the following codes and standards: 
 
ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code 
ASME BPE 
TEMA 
AHRI/ARI 
 
1.4. 
SUBMITTALS 
 
Reference specification section 230010 – Basic Mechanical requirements for submittal requirements in addition 
to those indicated in this section. 
 
Completed Data Sheets 
 
The Vendor/Manufacturer shall complete all fields indicated as VS* (Vendor Specified) on each data sheet, as 
well as correct/modify any other fields and values as required, and submit them with the initial bid, and as part of 
the final submittal documentation. 
 
Hygienic Heat Exchangers 
 
Hygienic heat exchangers are units that will be used for critical biopharmaceutical systems (product contact, USP 
compendial water and steam, etc.), and which shall comply with all applicable requirements of ASME BPE, 
 
 
 
Tube samples from the U-bend portions of U-tube heat exchangers shall be submitted for review and approval 
per ASME BPE requirements. 
 
Inlet and outlet nozzle design shall be coordinated with the installation of the piping.  Submit piping to and from 
heat exchanger for approval, showing all high point and low points and documentation to show complete drain-
ability of the heat exchanger and attached piping. 
 
Shell and Tube Heat Exchangers 
 
The Manufacturer shall submit a completed TEMA sheet indicating all operational parameters of each unit with 
the initial bid, and as part of the final submittal documentation. 
 
 
PART 2. - PRODUCTS 
 
Provide heat exchangers as indicated on the attached data sheets. 
 
 
PART 3. - EXECUTION 
 
Install heat exchangers as indicated on the drawings and as specified herein. 
 
Mount heat exchangers rigidly on steel skids, wall supports, or ceiling supports as indicated, and locate for 
required maintenance clearance. 
 
Provide piping as indicated on drawings and details.  Pipe relief valves outlets to drain, unless specifically 
indicated otherwise. 
 
After fabrication and testing, and prior to shipment, heat exchangers shall be cleaned throughout with a hot 
detergent solution, and then rinsed with clean water (non-sanitary units) or DI or RO water (sanitary units) and 
blown dry with dry nitrogen before sealing openings. 
 
Keep all ports capped at all times until connected to piping systems. 
 
 
END OF SECTION 
 
  VS * - Vendor/Manufacturer to Supply Information

Description:

        Equipment No.:  LA5ST2E101 
 
VS * - Vendor/Manufacturer to Supply Information 
REMARKS: 
 
1. Provide 2-year manufacturer’s warranty. 
2. All heat exchanger openings shall be capped. 
3. All heat exchangers shall be provided sheathed and insulated.  Insulation thickness shall be calculated 
to provide both personnel protection and heat conservation.  Minimum insulation efficiency:  90%. 
4. Any insulation used shall meet ASTM-E-84, E-800, and E-662 requirements for flammability and 
toxic gas generation. Insulation shall also meet ASTM-C795 and C-871 requirements for leachable 
ions/wicking and shall be compatible with Austenitic stainless steel. 
5. Heat exchanger will be located outside. 
6. Piping penetrations are not to be welded to the insulation sheathing.  
 
 
VS * - Vendor/Manufacturer to Supply Information 
VC* - Vendor/Manufacturer to Confirm Information

VS * - Vendor/Manufacturer to Supply Information 
VC* - Vendor/Manufacturer to Confirm Information 
 
R 
 
Spec. By 
I. Rumyantseva 
 
REMARKS: 
 
1. Provide 2 year manufacturer’s warranty. 
2. All heat exchanger openings shall be capped. 
3. All heat exchangers shall be provided sheathed and insulated.  Insulation thickness shall be calculated 
to provide both personnel protection and heat conservation.  Minimum insulation efficiency:  90%. 
4. Any insulation used shall meet ASTM-E-84, E-800, and E-662 requirements for flammability and 
toxic gas generation. Insulation shall also meet ASTM-C795 and C-871 requirements for leachable 
ions/wicking and shall be compatible with Austenitic stainless steel. 
5. Heating duty flow rate is 250 lpm.  Non-heating flow rate is 568 lpm.  Maximum allowable pressure 
drop of 10 psi on tube side shall not be exceeded at non-heating flow rate. 
6. Heating duty is based on loop temperature maintenance.  Assuming 3°C heat loss from loop. 
7. Heat exchanger will be located outside. 
8. Intermediate nozzle to be for vacuum breaker, and one for shell drain. 
9. Flexitallic Style CGI spiral wound semi-metallic type with 316L stainless steel winding strip, Flexicarb 
flexible graphite filler material, and carbon steel outer guide ring, 1/8" thick, complying with ASME 
B16.20. 
10. Piping penetrations are not to be welded to the insulation sheathing.  
 
 
 
  VS * - Vendor/Manufacturer to Supply Information 
  VC *- Vendor/Manufacturer to Confirm Information

REMARKS: 
 
1. Provide 2-year manufacturer’s warranty. 
2. All heat exchanger openings shall be capped. 
3. All heat exchangers shall be provided sheathed and insulated.  Insulation thickness shall be calculated 
to provide both personnel protection and heat conservation.  Minimum insulation efficiency:  90%. 
4. Any insulation used shall meet ASTM-E-84, E-800, and E-662 requirements for flammability and toxic 
gas generation. Insulation shall also meet ASTM-C795 and C-871 requirements for leachable 
ions/wicking and shall be compatible with Austenitic stainless steel. 
5. Heat exchanger will be located outside. 
6. Piping penetrations are not to be welded to the insulation sheathing.  
SECTION 230830 
HEATING TERMINAL UNITS 
 
 
INDEX 
PAGE 
PART 1. - GENERAL 
 
1.1. 
QUALITY ASSURANCE 
 
Codes and Standards 
 
AHRI Compliance:  Provide coil ratings in accordance with the latest version of AHRI Standard 410 
“Forced-Circulation Air-Cooling and Air-Heating Coils”. 
 
ASHRAE Compliance:  Test coils in accordance with the latest version of ASHRAE Standard 33 
“Methods of Testing Forced Circulation Air Cooling and Heating Coils.” 
 
UL Compliance:  Provide electrical components for terminal units that have been listed and labeled by 
UL. 
 
 
PART 2. - PRODUCTS 
 
2.1. 
FAN-COIL UNITS 
 
General:  Provide fan-coil units having cabinet sizes, and in locations indicated, and of capacities, and style 
indicated.  Include in basic unit chassis, coils, fanboard, drain pan assembly, fans, housing, motor, filter, 
insulation and control valves. 
 
Ceiling Exposed Cabinet Type:  Unit shall consist of basic unit casing enclosed in an attractive heavy-gauge 
steel cabinet finished with an electrostatically applied, baked-on paint.  Cabinet shall have a discharge duct 
opening.  Cabinet shall include a bottom hinged access panel as standard. 
 
Coils:  Coils shall have aluminum fins with copper tubes mechanically expanded for a permanent bond.  Water 
coils shall be field reversible.  Water coils have a manual air vent.  Construct of 5/8" seamless copper tubes 
mechanically bonded to configured aluminum fins.  Design for 300 psi working pressure, and leak test at 300 
psi under water. 
 
Fan Assembly:  Fans shall be DWDI forward curved, centrifugal type.  Fan housing shall be fabricated of 
heavy-gauge galvanized steel and of two-piece construction with a split fan housing that is easily removed, thus 
allowing complete access to the fans and motors. 
 
 
 
Motors:  Units shall have single-speed, sleeve bearing, permanent split capacitor motors with oilers, inherent 
thermal overload protection with automatic reset and resilient mounts. 
 
Speed Control:  Units shall be constant speed with integral modulating speed controller. 
 
Drain Pan:  Primary drain pan shall be constructed of 20 gauge stainless steel, insulated with closed cell 
insulation.  Secondary drain pan shall be constructed of injection molded polystyrene and meet UL code 94V-2 
for smoke and flame spread.  Secondary drain pan shall be equipped with a drain connection suitable to receive 
a 1/2" PVC socket elbow or coupling. 
 
Chassis:  Construct chassis of galvanized steel with flanged edges. 
 
Insulation:  1" foam injected 
 
Filters:  Provide 1" thick throwaway type filters in fiberboard frames. 
 
Accessories:  Provide the following accessories as indicated and/or scheduled: 
 
Acceptable Manufacturers:  Subject to compliance with requirements, provide fan-coil units of one of the 
following: 
 
Daikin 
Carrier 
International Environmental (IEC) 
Trane 
York 
 
 
PART 3. - EXECUTION 
 
3.1. 
INSTALLATION OF FAN-COIL UNITS 
 
General:  Install fan-coil units as indicated, and in accordance with manufacturer's installation instructions. 
 
Locate fan-coil units as indicated, coordinate with other trades to assure correct recess size for recessed units. 
 
Install piping as indicated. 
 
Protect units with protective covers during balance of construction. 
 
 
3.2. 
ELECTRICAL WIRING 
 
General:  Install electrical devices furnished by manufacturer but not specified to be factory-mounted.   
 
Verify that electrical wiring installation is in accordance with submittal data.   
 
3.3. 
ADJUSTING AND CLEANING 
 
General:  After construction is completed, including painting, clean unit exposed surfaces, vacuum clean 
terminal coils and inside of cabinets. 
 
 
 
Retouch any marred or scratched surfaces of factory-finished cabinets, using finish materials furnished by 
manufacturer. 
 
Install new filter units for terminals requiring same. 
 
 
END OF SECTION 
SECTION 230855 
CUSTOM AIR HANDLING UNITS 
 
INDEX 
PAGE 
 
PART 1. - GENERAL ............................................................................................................................................ 1 
PART 1. - GENERAL 
 
1.1. 
SCOPE 
 
Custom air handling units shall be designed and manufactured to the requirements of the specifications, data 
sheets, and drawings for this project. 
 
1.2. 
QUALITY ASSURANCE 
 
NEC Compliance:  Comply with National Electrical Code (NFPA 70) as applicable to installation and electrical 
connections of ancillary electrical components of air handling unit(s). 
 
Units shall be produced by a recognized manufacturer who maintains a local service agency and parts stock.  
 
Air handling units and major components shall be products of manufacturing firms regularly engaged in 
production of such equipment whose products have been in satisfactory use in similar service for not less than 
five (5) years. 
 
Fans shall conform to AMCA bulletins regarding testing and construction.  Airfoil fans shall bear the AMCA 
certified rating seal for airflow and sound. 
 
Coils shall be AHRI – “Forced-Circulation Air-Cooling and Air-Heating Coils” certified. 
 
Filter media shall be UL listed. 
 
Units with factory wiring shall be factory UL/ETL/CSA approved and labeled.  Failure to comply with this 
requirement will necessitate the manufacturer, at his expense, to have a certified UL/ETL/CSA representative 
inspect the equipment prior to affixing a label. 
 
 
1.3. 
SUBMITTALS 
 
Bid alternate and selection matrix for owner and engineer review. 
 
Product data shall include dimensions, weights, capacities, certifications, component performance, electrical 
characteristics, casing construction details, wiring interconnections, gauges and material finishes. 
 
The submittal shall provide all technical information relevant to the product being provided, including but not 
limited to, all the information shown in the attached data sheet and equipment schedules.  It is the responsibility 
of the supplier to highlight any variances the equipment has with the requirements of this specification whether 
or not pre-approval has been obtained.  Information shall be provided in the same measurement units as indicated 
in the data sheet and equipment schedules. 
 
The submittal(s) shall provide independent fan curves for operating/design conditions, with specified 
operating/design points clearly plotted. 
 
The submittal(s) shall provide coil selection worksheets, clearly showing proper consideration for altitude, air 
density, glycol corrections and indicate coil tube fin and casing construction. 
 
The submittal(s) shall provide filter information, including initial (clean) APD, final (dirty) APD, dust spot 
efficiency, final dust holding capacity, filter media description, filter frame details, and filter removal details. 
 
The manufacturer shall submit sound power levels for both air handling unit inlet, outlet and radiated at rated 
capacity. 
 
The manufacturer shall submit electrical requirements for power supply wiring including wiring diagrams for 
interlock and control wiring, clearly indicating factory-installed and field-installed wiring. 
 
The manufacturer shall submit the manufacturer’s recommended installation instructions. 
 
Omission of any of the above information will cause shop drawings to be immediately returned without review. 
 
1.4. 
OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE DATA 
 
The manufacturer shall submit operation and maintenance data under provisions of Section 230501. 
 
The manufacturer shall include instructions for lubrication, filter replacement, motor and drive replacement, spare 
parts lists, and wiring diagrams. 
 
1.5. 
WARRANTY 
 
Provide warranty in compliance with Section 230010. 
 
 
PART 2. - PRODUCTS 
 
2.1. 
CUSTOM AIR HANDLING UNITS 
 
Refer to attached data sheet and equipment schedules on plans for requirements. 
 
 
 
 
2.2. 
ACCEPTABLE MANUFACTURERS 
 
Specified manufacturers and approved equivalent manufacturers are as follows: 
 
Energy Labs 
BASX 
Buffalo 
 
Special Note:  The Engineer may reject any equipment item or accessory which in his opinion is not of the type 
or quality specified in data sheet(s) or drawings. 
 
2.3. 
MOTORS 
 
Select motors that are non-overloading within the full range of the fan performance curve, unless indicated 
otherwise. 
 
Motors that are indicated as VFD compatible, or that will be powered by a VFD, shall be provided with an AEGIS 
SGR shaft grounding ring, as manufactured by Electrostatic Technologies, integrally mounted to the output shaft 
of the motor.  This requirement is in addition to providing motors that are otherwise compatible with and designed 
to operate with a VFD.  
 
Motors shall be designed for operation with AC variable frequency controllers (VFD) for speed control 
applications when specified in the driven equipment specification.  At a minimum, adjustable frequency motors 
shall meet NEMA MG-1 Section IV, and Part 31 standards.  In addition, these motors shall have a minimum CIV 
(Corona Inception Voltage) rating of 1,488 volts at rated operating temperature. 
 
2.4. 
OPTIONS AND ACCESSORIES 
 
Each fan shall be provided with a VFD (e.g., a 4-fan array shall have 4 VFD’s) 
 
All duct openings in the floor of the AHU shall be provided with grating. 
 
AHU manufacturer to install all required controls conduit in the factory. Contractor to coordinate with BMS 
contractor and AHU manufacturer to ensure all controls conduit is installed in the factory, and no field 
penetrations are made for controls wiring or tubing. 
 
AHU manufacturer to provide a separate controls cabinet for a field installed BMS controller provided by others. 
Contractor to coordinate with BMS contractor and AHU manufacturer to ensure the proper enclosure size for the 
controls cabinet is provided. 
 
AHU manufacturer to provide an airflow measuring piezometer ring at fan cone. Transmitter to have a minimum 
of +/- 0.25% accuracy of span and an associated 10” unidirectional range (e.g., Ashcroft IXLDP IX3 10IW) 
Transmitter to be located in the controls cabinet for field BMS connection. Pneumatic tubing for the airflow 
measuring station shall have “tees” with blocking valves to isolate the instruments for field calibration devices. 
Provide calibration ports in cabinet so transmitters can be calibrated. 
 
All control devices shall be compatible with Siemens Desigo and Siemens Apogee. 
 
Electrical cabinet and controls cabinet to be mounted such that the positive pressure section of the AHU provides 
cooling air to the cabinet. 
All conduit penetrations for electrical and controls to be from the bottom of the electrical cabinet. Provide Meyers 
hub at all penetrations. 
 
 
VFD’s shall be provided with a COM card in addition to Ethernet connection for BMS controls interface. 
 
Windows on AHU access doors shall be no more than 5’ above the bottom of the AHU. 
 
AHU’s to have test ports in doors/panels for traverse readings, static pressure readings in each chamber, and other 
readings needed for balancing and calibration. 
 
OSA openings to be covered with a weather hood. 
 
PART 3. - EXECUTION 
 
3.1. 
SEQUENCING AND SCHEDULING 
 
Coordinate with the air handling unit manufacturer's representative and provide assistance as necessary for 
start-up services.   
 
3.2. 
GENERAL REQUIREMENTS 
 
Contractor shall take full responsibility for the air handling unit(s).  This includes removal from delivery truck, 
storing at a location acceptable to the Owner (if needed before installation), moving into place, setting, and 
installing in accordance with the manufacturer’s installation requirements, and all other work required to put air 
handling unit(s) into operation. 
 
The manufacturer shall provide the factory assembled air handling unit in configuration as indicated on the data 
sheets and drawings.  The unit shall include all specified components installed at the factory.  Field fabrication of 
units and their components will not be accepted unless prior approval in writing from the Engineer/Owner. 
 
Units too large to be legally shipped by truck may be shipped to the site in sections.  Otherwise units shall be 
shipped in one piece. 
 
3.3. 
DELIVERY, STORAGE AND HANDLING 
 
Protect fabricated casings, accessories and purchased products from damage during storage and handling.  Prevent 
end damage and prevent dirt and moisture from entering duct connection openings and fittings. 
 
Handle air handling unit(s) carefully to avoid damage to components, enclosures and finish.  Do not install 
damaged components.  Replace and return damaged components to air handling unit manufacturer for 
replacement and notify owner. 
 
Comply with Manufacturer's rigging and installation instructions for unloading air handling unit(s) and moving 
them to final location. 
 
3.4. 
INSTALLATION OF AIR HANDLING UNITS 
 
General:  Install air handling units where indicated, in accordance with equipment manufacturer's published 
installation instructions, and with recognized industry practices, to ensure that units comply with requirements 
and serve intended purposes. 
 
Coordination:  Coordinate with other work, including ductwork, floor construction, roof decking, and piping, as 
necessary to interface installation of air handling units with other work. 
 
Access:  Provide access space around air handling units for service as indicated, but in no case less than that 
recommended by manufacturer. 
 
 
 
Support:  Install floor-mounted air handling units on a manufacturer provided sheet metal roof curb and leveling 
concrete pad as indicated on structural drawings. 
 
Electrical Wiring:  Install electrical devices furnished by manufacturer but not specified to be factory-mounted, 
according to manufacturer's directions.   
 
Piping Connections:  Provide piping, valves, accessories, gauges, supports, and flexible connectors as indicated 
on drawings.  
 
Field installed piping accessories (gauges, valves, strainers, circuit setters, etc.) on field installed piping to be no 
more than 6’ above the roof line. 
 
Duct Connections:  Refer to Division 23 Ductwork, and Ductwork Accessories sections.  Provide ductwork, 
accessories, and flexible connections as indicated on drawings. 
 
Grounding:  Provide positive equipment ground for air handling unit components. 
 
Control Components:  Install control components indicated to be located in the air handling unit sections.  
Coordinate with Controls contractor. 
 
All field installed controls wiring and/or tubing shall be installed within conduit. 
 
All field installed control devices and instruments to be located within the controls cabinet. 
 
Verify that airflow measuring station pitot tubes are secured firmly, oriented properly, and free from interference 
with dampers and/or fans. 
 
 
3.5. 
FIELD QUALITY CONTROL 
 
Coordination:  The manufacturer will provide the services of a factory authorized service representative to start 
the units and instruct the Owner's personnel in proper operation of the units.  Coordinate with the manufacturer's 
representative.   
 
 
3.6. 
PERFORMANCE TESTS 
 
Perform factory panel deflection tests, cabinet leakage test, and airflow tests for each AHU. Provide a written 
report to the Owner showing all performance data and certifying compliance with the specification requirements.   
 
Provide factory and field performance tests of airflow measuring stations. Each airflow measuring station’s CFM, 
amperage, and DP to be within 5% of each other as reported by the BMS. If readings are not within 5% of each 
other appropriate measures shall be taken to rectify including, but not limited to adjusting location/orientation, 
re-calibrating transmitters,  and ensuring no tubing is pinched or crimped. 
 
Perform a full performance test of each air handling unit after installation is complete and each unit has been 
started and operated.  Test units to ensure proper coil performance, fan performance, and housing leakage rates, 
in accordance with the specifications.  Provide a written report to the Owner showing all performance data and 
certifying compliance with the specification requirements.  Coordinate with the air handling unit manufacturer 
for replacement of all components which do not meet the performance specifications.   
 
 
3.7. 
EXTRA FILTER STOCK 
 
The manufacturer or contractor will provide one extra set of pre-filters for each air handling unit.  Install new 
filters at completion of air handling system work, and prior to testing, adjusting, and balancing work.  Obtain 
receipt from testing and balancing contractor that new filters have been installed. 
 
END OF SECTION 
VS * - Vendor/Manufacturer to Supply Information 
 
R

JY

DESCRIPTION

REMARKS: 
 
1. Provide manufacturer’s one (1) year warranty.  Warranty period shall begin at equipment start-up or six 
months after delivery, whichever occurs first. 
 
2. Provide one (1) extra set of filters for installation by contractor prior to final balancing. 
 
3. Sealants shall be non-sag, non-staining, permanently flexible, of the highest quality and recommended by 
its manufacturer for the intended application.  Sealant (gasket) materials shall not be reactive, additive, 
or absorbtive so as to alter the air (fluid) stream. 
 
4. Unit and components shall be selected for design conditions specified above and then manufacturer shall 
provide operating performance for unit and components selected. 
 
5. Provide a spare parts list and a firm quote price for spare parts.

Description: 
Custom Air Handling Unit 
Equipment No.: 
AHU-51 
 
 
6. Unit shall be fully performance tested at site after installation, for coil performance, housing leakage rate, 
and fan performance.  Manufacturer shall replace or correct any components not meeting project 
specifications.  
 
7. Unit manufacturer shall provide a qualified service technician for start-up of unit and to instruct Owner's 
personnel for a minimum of eight (8) hours on maintenance and operation of unit. 
 
8. Unit shall be thoroughly cleaned to remove all dust, grease, excess sealant, and other debris.  All openings 
shall be sealed airtight prior to shipment. 
 
9. Owner approved equivalent filters may be provided in lieu of filters, specified above. 
 
10. Insulation shall have a flame spread rating of 25 and a smoke developed rating of 50. 
 
11. Provide a flanged connection for all duct connections to the unit (i.e. supply air, return air, outside, air, 
relief air) 
 
12. Maximum wall or roof deflection shall not exceed L/200 at 8” of static pressure. Maximum leakage shall 
not exceed 1% of unit capacity at 125% of design static pressure. Maximum live load floor deflection shall 
not exceed the lesser of L/360 and 1/2 inch and floor shall be suitably braced to prevent "oil canning." 
 
13. Units will be located on the roof which will be exposed to outdoor air conditions of 82F db / 72F wb.  Design 
of air handling units shall be such that air handling unit casing will not cause condensation. 
 
14. Each unit/module shall be supplied with four (4) lifting points at a minimum.  Manufacturer to provide 
lifting lugs and bracing for each unit/module. 
 
15. Provide piezometer ring on fan inlet with flow transmitter at accuracy above. 
 
16. Select fans for both conditions of 4 fans operating and 3 fans operating. Ensure proper wheel diameter and 
percent wheel width for acceptable RPM and acceptable location on the static pressure curve for both 
conditions. 
 
17. Pressure transmitters and displays and other gauges with readings need to be at an accessible height for 
visual checks on AHU mounted on curb by operator standing on the roof without use of a ladder or stool.
